subject: Politics
title: Elite Fractures
description: A micro-lesson that makes Elite Fractures usable.

hook.text: Unified elites crush protests. Divided elites join them. Revolutions succeed when the powerful turn on each other.

buildup.text: When ruling elites split â€” military versus civilians, reformers versus hardliners â€” revolutionaries find an opening.

discovery.text: In the French Revolution, nobles and clergy defected to the Third Estate. Elite betrayal sealed the monarchy's fate.

twist.text: The Soviet collapse happened partly because Communist Party reformers undermined hardliners from within.

climax.text: In Egypt, the military abandoned Mubarak in 2011. Without elite backing, thirty years of rule ended in 18 days.

punchline.text: Regimes fall from the top, not the bottom. Elite splits open the door.

quiz.question: Why are elite fractures important for revolutions?
options: Divided elites create openings that revolutionaries can exploit
Unified elites always support popular movements
Elites never play a role in revolutions
